application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
decision_conditions: detrimental affect on health and appeara
description: 1 x Atlantic Cedar (applicants ref. T39) - Reduce height and spread by up to 1-1.5m, re shape canopy for general tree maintenance, remove major dead wood and any storm damaged limbs for safety. Strip and remove ivy to avoid any further damage to the tree and branches. Standing in T39 of Tree Preservation Order.1 x Silver Birch (applicants ref. T41) - Reduce height and spread by 1.5m, to rebalance crown and for general tree maintenance. No previous work present. Remove dead wood and ivy from base. Standing in T41 of Tree Preservation Order.1 x Atlantic Cedar (applicants ref. T42) - Reduce height by 1m and spread by 2m, no significant past management noted, remove all dead wood threw out canopy and hung up branches for safety. Cutting back away from property for a 2m clearance. Lift low branches up to 10 ft in height for clearance to gain better access into the front driveway and to the grounds and to lift the crown. Remove any ivy growing up the main trunk and branches down to ground level and grub out. All works to be carried out for general tree maintenance and for the health of the tree. Standing in T42 of Tree Preservation Order.4 x Lawson Cypress (applicants ref. G24) - Remove down to ground level. These trees provide no amenity value and are all 50-70% dead. 2 in which have already fallen over and are covered in ivy. Trees of similar species will be planted in their position. Standing in Group G24 of Tree Preservation Order.
